trans-unit.source: Add Mobile Services to an existing app (Xamarin.iOS) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add Mobile Services to an existing app (Xamarin.iOS) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to store and access data from your Azure Mobile Services Xamarin.iOS app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to store and access data from your Azure Mobile Services Xamarin.iOS app.

trans-unit.source: Add Mobile Services to an existing app
trans-unit.target: Add Mobile Services to an existing app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to leverage data in a Xamarin.iOS app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to leverage data in a Xamarin.iOS app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will download an app that stores data in memory, create a new mobile service, integrate the mobile service with the app, and then login to the Azure Management Portal to view changes to data made when running the app.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will download an app that stores data in memory, create a new mobile service, integrate the mobile service with the app, and then login to the Azure Management Portal to view changes to data made when running the app.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how Mobile Services enables you to use Azure to store and retrieve data from a Xamarin.iOS app.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how Mobile Services enables you to use Azure to store and retrieve data from a Xamarin.iOS app.

trans-unit.source: As such, this topic walks you through many of the steps that are completed for you in the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: As such, this topic walks you through many of the steps that are completed for you in the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, consider first completing the tutorial <link><linkText>Get started with Mobile Services</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, consider first completing the tutorial <link><linkText>Get started with Mobile Services</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Download the Xamarin.iOS app project[github]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Download the Xamarin.iOS app project[github]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: [Create the mobile service]
trans-unit.target: [Create the mobile service]

trans-unit.source: [Add a data table for storage]
trans-unit.target: [Add a data table for storage]

trans-unit.source: [Update the app to use Mobile Services]
trans-unit.target: [Update the app to use Mobile Services]

trans-unit.source: [Test the app against Mobile Services]
trans-unit.target: [Test the app against Mobile Services]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the [Azure Mobile Services Component], <link><linkText>XCode 6.0[install xcode]</linkText><title></title></link>, [Xamarin.iOS], and iOS 7.0 or later versions.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the [Azure Mobile Services Component], <link><linkText>XCode 6.0[install xcode]</linkText><title></title></link>, [Xamarin.iOS], and iOS 7.0 or later versions.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Download the GetStartedWithData project
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Download the GetStartedWithData project

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is built on the <link><linkText>GetStartedWithData app[github]</linkText><title></title></link>, which is a Xamarin.iOS app.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is built on the <link><linkText>GetStartedWithData app[github]</linkText><title></title></link>, which is a Xamarin.iOS app.

trans-unit.source: The UI for this app is identical to the app generated by the Mobile Services Xamarin.iOS quickstart, except that added items are stored locally in memory.
trans-unit.target: The UI for this app is identical to the app generated by the Mobile Services Xamarin.iOS quickstart, except that added items are stored locally in memory.

trans-unit.source: Download the <link><linkText>GetStartedWithData app[github]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Download the <link><linkText>GetStartedWithData app[github]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In Xamarin Studio, open the downloaded project and examine the TodoService class.
trans-unit.target: In Xamarin Studio, open the downloaded project and examine the TodoService class.

trans-unit.source: Notice that there are several // TODO comments that specify the steps you must take to make this app work with your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Notice that there are several // TODO comments that specify the steps you must take to make this app work with your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Run menu and choose Start Without Debugging to start the app.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Run menu and choose Start Without Debugging to start the app.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type some text in the text box, then click the + button.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type some text in the text box, then click the + button.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the saved text is displayed in the list below.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the saved text is displayed in the list below.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create a new mobile service in the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create a new mobile service in the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add a new table to the mobile service
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add a new table to the mobile service

trans-unit.source: To be able to store app data in the new mobile service, you must first create a new table in the associated SQL Database instance.
trans-unit.target: To be able to store app data in the new mobile service, you must first create a new table in the associated SQL Database instance.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the Data tab, then click +Create.
trans-unit.target: Click the Data tab, then click +Create.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Create new table dialog.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Create new table dialog.

trans-unit.source: In Table name type TodoItem, then click the check button.
trans-unit.target: In Table name type TodoItem, then click the check button.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new storage table TodoItem with the default permissions set, which means that any user of the app can access and change data in the table.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new storage table TodoItem with the default permissions set, which means that any user of the app can access and change data in the table.

trans-unit.source: The same table name is used in Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: The same table name is used in Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: However, each table is created in a schema that is specific to a given mobile service.
trans-unit.target: However, each table is created in a schema that is specific to a given mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This is to prevent data collisions when multiple mobile services use the same database.
trans-unit.target: This is to prevent data collisions when multiple mobile services use the same database.

trans-unit.source: Click the new TodoItem table and verify that there are no data rows.
trans-unit.target: Click the new TodoItem table and verify that there are no data rows.

trans-unit.source: Click the Columns tab and verify that there is only a single id column, which is automatically created for you.
trans-unit.target: Click the Columns tab and verify that there is only a single id column, which is automatically created for you.

trans-unit.source: This is the minimum requirement for a table in Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This is the minimum requirement for a table in Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: When dynamic schema is enabled on your mobile service, new columns are created automatically when JSON objects are sent to the mobile service by an insert or update operation.
trans-unit.target: When dynamic schema is enabled on your mobile service, new columns are created automatically when JSON objects are sent to the mobile service by an insert or update operation.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use the new mobile service as data storage for the app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use the new mobile service as data storage for the app.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Update the app to use the mobile service for data access
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Update the app to use the mobile service for data access

trans-unit.source: Now that your mobile service is ready, you can update the app to store items in Mobile Services instead of the local collection.
trans-unit.target: Now that your mobile service is ready, you can update the app to store items in Mobile Services instead of the local collection.

trans-unit.source: If you don't already have Azure Mobile Services listed in the Components folder, you can get it by right-clicking Components, choosing Get More Components and then searching for Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: If you don't already have Azure Mobile Services listed in the Components folder, you can get it by right-clicking Components, choosing Get More Components and then searching for Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution view in Xamarin Studio, open the TodoService class and uncomment the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: In the Solution view in Xamarin Studio, open the TodoService class and uncomment the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the Dashboard tab and make a note of the Site URL, then click Manage keys and make a note of the Application key.
trans-unit.target: Click the Dashboard tab and make a note of the Site URL, then click Manage keys and make a note of the Application key.

trans-unit.source: In the Constants class, uncomment the following constants:
trans-unit.target: In the Constants class, uncomment the following constants:

trans-unit.source: Replace AppUrl and AppKey in the above constants with the values you found above in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Replace AppUrl and AppKey in the above constants with the values you found above in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the TodoService class, uncomment the following line of code:
trans-unit.target: In the TodoService class, uncomment the following line of code:

trans-unit.source: This creates a property that represents the MobileServiceClient that connects to the service
trans-unit.target: This creates a property that represents the MobileServiceClient that connects to the service

trans-unit.source: In the TodoService class, uncomment the following line of code:
trans-unit.target: In the TodoService class, uncomment the following line of code:

trans-unit.source: This creates a property representation for your mobile services table.
trans-unit.target: This creates a property representation for your mobile services table.

trans-unit.source: Uncomment the following lines in the TodoService constructor:
trans-unit.target: Uncomment the following lines in the TodoService constructor:

trans-unit.source: This creates an instance of the Mobile Services client and creates the TodoItem table instance.
trans-unit.target: This creates an instance of the Mobile Services client and creates the TodoItem table instance.

trans-unit.source: Uncomment the following lines in the RefreshDataAsync method in TodoService
trans-unit.target: Uncomment the following lines in the RefreshDataAsync method in TodoService

trans-unit.source: This creates a query to return all tasks that have not yet been completed.
trans-unit.target: This creates a query to return all tasks that have not yet been completed.

trans-unit.source: Locate the InsertTodoItemAsync method, and uncomment the following line:
trans-unit.target: Locate the InsertTodoItemAsync method, and uncomment the following line:

trans-unit.source: This code sends an insert request to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This code sends an insert request to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Locate the CompleteItemAsync method, and uncomment the following line:
trans-unit.target: Locate the CompleteItemAsync method, and uncomment the following line:

trans-unit.source: This code removes TodoItems after they are marked as completed.
trans-unit.target: This code removes TodoItems after they are marked as completed.

trans-unit.source: Now that the app has been updated to use Mobile Services for backend storage, it's time to test the app against Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Now that the app has been updated to use Mobile Services for backend storage, it's time to test the app against Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Test the app against your new mobile service
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Test the app against your new mobile service

trans-unit.source: In Xamarin Studio, select an emulator or device to deploy to from one of the primary comboboxes, then go to the Run menu and select Start WithoutDebugging to start the app.
trans-unit.target: In Xamarin Studio, select an emulator or device to deploy to from one of the primary comboboxes, then go to the Run menu and select Start WithoutDebugging to start the app.

trans-unit.source: This executes your Azure Mobile Services client, built with Xamarin.iOS, that queries items from your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This executes your Azure Mobile Services client, built with Xamarin.iOS, that queries items from your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: As before, type text in the textbox, and then click the + button..
trans-unit.target: As before, type text in the textbox, and then click the + button..

trans-unit.source: This sends a new item as an insert to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This sends a new item as an insert to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the [Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the [Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Click the Data tab, then click Browse.
trans-unit.target: Click the Data tab, then click Browse.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the TodoItem table now contains data, with id values generated by Mobile Services, and that columns have been automatically added to the table to match the TodoItem class in the app.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the TodoItem table now contains data, with id values generated by Mobile Services, and that columns have been automatically added to the table to match the TodoItem class in the app.

trans-unit.source: This concludes the Get started with data tutorial for Xamarin.iOS.
trans-unit.target: This concludes the Get started with data tutorial for Xamarin.iOS.

trans-unit.source: Get completed example
trans-unit.target: Get completed example

trans-unit.source: Download the [completed example project].
trans-unit.target: Download the [completed example project].

trans-unit.source: Be sure to update the applicationURL and applicationKey variables with your own Azure settings.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to update the applicationURL and applicationKey variables with your own Azure settings.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling an iOS app to work with data in Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling an iOS app to work with data in Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Next, consider completing one of the following tutorials that is based on the GetStartedWithData app that you created in this tutorial:
trans-unit.target: Next, consider completing one of the following tutorials that is based on the GetStartedWithData app that you created in this tutorial:

trans-unit.source: [Validate and modify data with scripts]
trans-unit.target: [Validate and modify data with scripts]

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Learn more about using server scripts in Mobile Services to validate and change data sent from your app.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Learn more about using server scripts in Mobile Services to validate and change data sent from your app.

trans-unit.source: [Refine queries with paging]
trans-unit.target: [Refine queries with paging]

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Learn how to use paging in queries to control the amount of data handled in a single request.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Learn how to use paging in queries to control the amount of data handled in a single request.

trans-unit.source: Once you have completed the data series, try these other iOS tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Once you have completed the data series, try these other iOS tutorials:

trans-unit.source: [Get started with authentication]
trans-unit.target: [Get started with authentication]

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Learn how to authenticate users of your app.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Learn how to authenticate users of your app.

trans-unit.source: [Get started with push notifications]
trans-unit.target: [Get started with push notifications]

trans-unit.source: <html></html>Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app with Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app with Mobile Services.
